page.title: 01DERWENT VALLEY - GENERAL
page.content: The D-block rural area lies in the heart of the beautiful Derwent Valley, part in Tyne & Wear and part in county Durham. At Lintzford the valley opens out into a wide, circular, tree shaded ampitheatre of level land and is a convenient place from which to visit the nearby Chopwell Woodlands. In the area, but not open to the public, is Hamsterley Hall which holds excellent specimens of ancient swords of the Shotley Bridge German sword makers. The countryside was once dotted with coalmines which are now closed. Employment includes farming, forestry, inkworks, light engineering, horticulture, with a few services in garages, shops, inns, riding stables and tourism. There is one main road and the Derwent Walk Country Park.
